description.narrative: Sustainable Finance of Papua New Guinea’s Protected Area Network- Global Fund Project_GEF 6

activity-description.narrative: Sustainable Financing of Papua New Guinea
Sustainable Financing of Papua New Guinea
Sustainable Financing of Papua New Guinea
Sustainable Financing of Papua New Guinea

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1) Area of land and marine habitat recognised by CEPA 2) Improvement in the management effectiveness of protected areas score for sites receiving support from the Biodiversity Fund 3) Number of direct project beneficiaries, of which >65% are women and youth 4) Status of institutional mapping and mandates with respect to protected area management 5) Financial Scorecard 6) Capacity of organisations as measured using the Capacity and Competency Scorecard 7) Biodiversity Fund structure and governance in place. indicated by:-• Governing and operational structures – including the Steering Committee and Technical Secretariat – are in place 8) Biodiversity Fund operationalisation through a sinking fund. GoPNG,GEF grant funds and the fund raising/resource mobilisation strategy 9) Number of protected areas accessing funding from Biodiversity Fund 10) Protected area management effectiveness 11) The generation and use of revenue streams for protected area management in the three selected protected areas (Sepik Wetlands, Mt Wilhelm and Kimbe Bay) 12) Gender responsive linkages between sustainable financing of protected areas and environmental protection, and well-being of communities 13) Number of lessons (identified and disseminated by the project) used in development and implementation of other protected areas.

comment.narrative: The three key weaknesses in the system are: i) insufficient and unreliable revenue streams; ii) lack of capacity to secure and manage financial resources; and iii) a clear framework for investment in this sector.

Output 1.1 Institutional Analysis and mapping of CEPA, Wards and LLGs Targets: 1. Stakeholders mapping developed 2. Analysis of policy and regulatory framework for PA financing developed 3. Roadmap on PA Financing developed
Output 1.2 Development of PA Business Plan and initial implementation supported Targets: 1. National Level PA business plan developed
Output 2.1 Establishment of the Biodiversity Fund Governing and operational structures Targets: 1. Institutional design of Biodiversity Fund initiated 2. Review of best practice for establishment of Biodiversity Fund 3. Review existing policies and legislation in PNG to enable the establishment of a Fund 4. Legal and operational structure options for the Fund developed
Output 3.1 Active role of women, children and other marginalized groups Targets: 1. Environmental and Social Management Framework updated 2. Gender action plan and gender analysis for pilot sites updated
Output 3.2 Mechanisms to catalyze revenue streams to deliver to selected PA tested Targets: 1.Indigenous Peoples Plan developed for pilot sites 2. Grant Proposals drafted
Output 3.3 Documentation of various practices by different organizations and lessons learnt from them will be disseminated Target: 1. PNG METT revised through a peer review 2. Publication of PNG METT 3. Interactive online tool to communicate the results of the new METT created
Output 3.4 Lessons Learnt through M&E of the project Targets: 1. Project Monitoring and evaluation framework reviewed and updated 2. PA forum established with first forum convened.
Project Implementation Review 1. PIR process is conducted 2. Data collection process is coordinated by the PM and implemented by team members 3. Draft PIR is submitted for review

The Project is in the progress of implementation of its activities and the results will be achieved towards the end of 2021. Most of the 2020 key activities will be completed by mid 2021 including - Institutional and Regulatory Review report (Output 1.1) shall be completed in March 2021, National PA finance and investment plan (Output 1.2), establishment of the Biodiversity Fund (Output 2.1) - to be accomplished in June 2021, final draft of SES management framework and Gender Analysis and Action Plan updated (Output 3.1), Indigenous Peoples Plan completed (Output 3.2), and PNG METT approved and field tested (Output 3.3).

Output 1.1 Institutional Analysis and mapping of stakeholders 1. Identified stakeholders signed agreement to demonstrated roles and responsibilities 2. Stakeholders trained on results of institutional/regulatory review and PA finance and investment plan 3. Stakeholders trained on PA management and financing 4. PA establishment process developed and shared with stakeholders 5. Case studies on PA management documented
Output 1.2 Business Plan for PA system of PNG developed and initial implementation supported 1. National level PA finance and investment plan developed and approved 2. National PA finance and investment plan implementation published 3. National PA finance taskforce for the plan implementation established 4. At least 5 feasibility studies for viable finance options developed
Output 1.3 Capacity of relevant organizations an institutions development to deliver improved protected area management and governance, transparency and accountability and financial management across the country. 1. National PA training programme established 2. Provincial workshops for PA established and management conducted 3. Provincial training for business training and financial management of PAs conducted 4. Study tour to learn PA best practice undertaken
Output 2.1 Biodiversity Fund governing and operational structures are established 1. National biodiversity Fund regulation/legislation approved 2. National Biodiversity fund established and launched 3. Fund administrator and investment manager hired 4. Offices of fund secretariat established and technical secretariat hired
Output 2.2 Fund Strategic and operational frameworks are developed 1. Fund strategic plan approved 2. Fund operational manuals approved
Output 2.3 Fund -raising strategy/ resource mobilization strategy for the Biodiversity Fund is developed and implemented 1. Fund resource mobilization strategy approved.
Output 3.1 Mechanisms to deliver funds to protected areas and for participatory natural resource management tested 1. First round of call for proposals completed 2. First grant disbursements made to selected grantees.
Output 3.2 Mechanisms to catalyse (or consolidate) revenue streams to deliver funds to selected protected areas tested 1. Indigenous Peoples Plan developed for pilot sites 2. Grant proposals drafted 3. Grant agreements for selected implementing partners signed 4. Climate Change vulnerability assessments completed for each pilot site
Output 3.3 Lessons Learnt from implementing partner organizations documented and disseminated 1. Revised METT for PNG adopted 2. National and provincial training on the revised METT provided 3. Series of case studies on PA success stories on management, governance and financing developed and disseminated 4. A video showcasing PA management in PNG for national and international audiences developed
Output 3.4 Lessons Learnt from project through M&E are used for overall knowledge management, enhancing synergies, sharing experiences and learning 1. Baseline capacity scorecards are completed 2. PA forum established with first forum convened
Output 4 Project Management 1. Day-to-day project management support provided 2. Draft PIR submitted for review

The Project is in the progress of implementation of its activities and the results will be achieved towards the end of 2021. The project has strategized to complete most of the 2021 key activities by mid 2022 because of the COVID 19 pandemic and limited consultations with government counterparts and stakeholders. This will include - PA establishment process developed and shared with stakeholders, and case studies on PA management documented (Output 1.1); National PA finance taskforce for the plan implementation established, and 5 feasibility studies for viable finance options developed (Output 1.2); Study tour to learn PA best practice undertaken (Output 1.3) will be completed in Quarter 2; National Biodiversity Fund established and launched (Output 2.1); Fund administrator and investment manager hired, and offices of fund secretariat established and technical secretariat hired (Output 2.1) will be completed in June 2022; Fund strategic plan and operational manuals approved (Output 2.2); Fund resource mobilization strategy approved (Output 2.3); First round of call for proposals completed and first grant disbursements made to selected grantees (Output 3.1); Grant proposals drafted, Grant agreements for selected implementing partners signed, and Climate Change vulnerability assessments will be completed for each pilot site with support from the responsible party in 2022 (Output 3.2); and a video showcasing PA management in PNG for national and international audiences to be developed in 2022 (Output 3.3).

Output 1.1: Four regional knowledge sharing events to present the results and implications of the following outputs under component 1: (i) Institutional and regulatory review; (ii) PA finance and investment plan; (iii) Results of the first PA Forum; (iv) PA Bill, (v) PA establishment and management process, guides and templates 1. Institutional and regulatory review knowledge shared with stakeholders 2. PA finance and investment plan shared with stakeholders 3. Results of the first PA Forum shared with stakeholders 4. PA Bill enactment and information shared with stakeholders 5. PA establishment and management process, guides and templates shared with stakeholders
Output 1.2: Design and implementation of the finance solutions proposed in the PA Finance and Investment Plan (Budget committed from 2021 AWP) 1. National level consultation process on the design, implementation arrangements for national level PA finance solutions identified in the PA Finance and Investment Plan 2. Establishment of a protected area finance task force for the implementation of the plan 3. Development of NEC submissions and draft legislation for each finance solution.
Output 1.3: The capacity of relevant organizations and institutions development to deliver improved protected area management and governance, transparency and accountability, and financial management across the country. 1. Implementation of PA management modules (developed under GEF 5 project) for PA stakeholders during PA Forum. 2. Study tour for key PA finance stakeholders and Fund Secretariat to learn best practice for PA management, governance and financing (Asian Parks Congress identified)
Output 2.1: The Biodiversity Fund’s governing and operational structures are established. 1. MOU and TOR for Fund is signed between the UN RC and Department of National Planning and Monitoring (DNPM) 2. Fund Secretariat staff are appointed and trained - Executive Director (NPSA Senior Programme Officer), Programme Manager (NPSA Program Officer), Finance Manager (NPSA Finance Officer) 3. Fund is launched internationally (UN Biodiversity COP identified) 4. Domestic awareness raising of the Fund’s vision, strategy and operational rules conducted at a national and regional level 5. The Fund office is opened and furnished
Output 2.2: The Fund’s strategic and operational frameworks are developed 1. Finalisation of the Strategic Plan and operational manuals for the Fund are adopted by the Board (Budget committed from 2021 AWP)
Output 2.3: A fund-raising strategy/resource mobilisation strategy for the Biodiversity Fund is developed and implemented. 1. Development and implementation of the resource mobilisation plan (Budget committed from 2021 AWP) 2. Funding proposals developed identified under the resource mobilisation plan. (Budget committed from 2021 AWP)
Output 3.1: Mechanisms to deliver funds to protected areas and for participatory natural resource management tested 1. Fund issues first call for proposals for PAs 2. Grants are issued under LVG modalities to Protected Areas
Output 3.2: Mechanisms to catalyse (or consolidate) revenue streams to deliver funds to selected protected areas tested. 1. Grant agreement with Responsible Party is signed 2. Ecological and economic baseline assessment for project target sites conducted in Year 1 3. Climate change vulnerability assessment for project target sites undertaken in Year 1 4. Livelihood assessment for project target sites conducted in Year 1 5. Business plans for prioritised PA financing actions and livelihoods conducted in Year 1
Output 3.3: In a learning process, the diverse practices that are being implemented by various partner organisations across the country will be documented and the lessons learned from them will be disseminated 1. Develop a video showcasing protected area management in PNG for national and international audiences. 2. Mid-term review of the project conducted [Prepare ToR, advertisement, issue contract to international and national consultants)
Output 3.4: Lessons learned by the project through participatory M&E are used for overall knowledge management, enhancing synergies, sharing experiences and learning 1. Assess capacity scorecards for CEPA and each partner province 2. Organise national PA Forum (currently under development and funded through 2020 AWP)
Output 4.0: Project Management 1. Day-to-day project management and support to assurance activities

The implementation of the project activities is in progress and the results will be achieved towards the end of 2022. The project has strategized to complete most of the 2021 key activities by mid 2022 because of the COVID 19 pandemic and limited consultations with government counterparts and stakeholders. This will include - PA establishment process developed and shared with stakeholders, and case studies on PA management documented (Output 1.1); National PA finance taskforce for the plan implementation established, and 5 feasibility studies for viable finance options developed (Output 1.2); Study tour to learn PA best practice will be completed in Quarter 2 (Output 1.3) ; National Biodiversity Fund established and launched (Output 2.1); Fund administrator and investment manager hired, and offices of fund secretariat established and technical secretariat hired (Output 2.1) will be completed in June 2022; Fund strategic plan and operational manuals approved (Output 2.2); Fund resource mobilization strategy approved (Output 2.3); First round of call for proposals completed and first grant disbursements made to selected grantees (Output 3.1); Grant proposals drafted, Grant agreements for selected implementing partners signed, and Climate Change vulnerability assessments will be completed for each pilot site with support from the responsible party in 2022 (Output 3.2); and a video showcasing PA management in PNG for national and international audiences to be developed in 2022 (Output 3.3).
a) PPG coordination a) Situation analysis (the baseline situation) b) Feasibility assessments
a) PPG coordination implemented b) Inception workshop conducted c) Feasibility assessment was not implemented.
